revised_title: On the Laws of Polarization of Light by Refraction
tldr: The author, David Brewster, investigates the laws of polarization of light by refraction. He demonstrates that the polarizing force of a refracting surface changes the position of the planes of polarized light. Brewster establishes the true laws of the phenomena through experiments and deduces a formula representing the variation of the rotation corresponding to the deviation of the refracted ray. He concludes that refraction cannot produce rays truly polarized, and each refracting surface produces a change in the position of the planes of polarization, approaching complete polarization.
